message.content:
cs.DB, cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.SE. 

The paper discusses a formal framework for split-correctness in information extraction, which involves the segmentation of text into document segments for parallel evaluation. This topic is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including database systems (cs.DB) for efficient query processing, natural language processing (cs.CL) for information extraction from text, information retrieval (cs.IR) for indexing and searching large document collections, machine learning (cs.LG) for training models on segmented data, and software engineering (cs.SE) for debugging and testing information extractors.
